caption: An interesting visit in Paris if you want to experience something different from normal Parisian tourism. This is a six-story building filled with Street art created by amateur artists. I guarantee you will find art that you have not seen before in this location. You can also purchase art while you're in there, there is music on some of the floors, and you can actually speak to some of the artists. This is a free entrance with a donation of your choice upon leaving. Fully recommended to leave donation and visit while in Paris.

Off the main tourist route, if you like quirky art, well worth the visit!! Free entry, leave a donation, especially if you had a good experience! Many floors, so be aware of climbing. I'm not sure it's accessible for all.  Best to check. Otherwise, it's a super way to support local budding artists!  A lot of fun!

We decided to try something different and free while in Paris. My friends found the Artist Studio at 59 Rivoli...so we checked it.  It is close to a Metro stop. And, the guy at reception was nice. I left a few Euros in the "tip" basket for a contribution to the artists. We then started walking up the stairs. There were a lot of people because hey, it is free, it is art in Paris and it was cold and rainy outside.  Many of the artist where there. I ended up purchasing some small items. Some of the artists were actually painting/working. Cool to watch and not really sure how they could focus with people talking and walking around them. It was really packed with people so it got hot and walking around was more like shuffling.  It doesn't take much time to see it all. Some stuff was really cool and other stuff not so thrilling.  What I enjoyed most was the building and how it was painted inside. As you can see by my photos. The top floor was cool. We enjoyed the short excursion.  NOTE... If you do not like stairs, you might not like this place.

This is a live studio with artists working away on  some of the floors. Entry is free but they do accept donations. Most of the paintings are abstract/contemporary. The stairs are beautifully painted. I would definitely recommend visiting this place.

I love this place, cool rotating artists and creatives every couple months, lots of stairs, kinda cramped but not too bad, you can purchase art directly from the artists themselves and speak to them if you'd like!

amazing art and cultural center in the heart of Paris city! If you‚Äôre strolling around near by then this place is a must visit if you claim yourself love art and artworks! Definitely a gem and they open for donation only. Lucky you if they‚Äôre held an exhibition there.

One of the best free things to do in Paris. You can watch beautiful murals along the stairs and take a peek inside the artist's studios. If you are lucky, you might catch an artist bringing their vision to life. Most of the paintings are very contemporary/abstract so you may not like if that's not your style.

A highly unique experience which is sure to fascinate any visual artist. 59 Rivoli is a center solely dedicated to visual arts, that is to say, you won't find any novels or songs here. Additionally, almost all of the showcased works are situated firmly within the "modern art" umbrella, which certainly isn't for everybody. The building seems like it is ever-changing, but when I visited, it was divided into 2 sections: One is a small two-floored gallery where finished products seem to be showcased. The artworks vary from paintings, to sculptures, to murals, and more. Almost all of them physically present in the piece, rather than digital pieces. The second part is a six-story building where the artists themselves work. The completely open-to-public nature of these floors allows for anyone to walk among the work-in-progress paintings, and half-built models, and watch the artists live at work. This means that if any artwork or particular style catches your attention, you can chat directly with the artist. This humanizing aspect of 59 Rivoli is definitely what makes in interesting and sets it apart from being just another modern art gallery. I would recommend any artistic soul passing by the area to give this building a visit, no matter how short, no matter how interested you may be in modern art. Simply because it is such a unique experience.

59 Rivoli is a winding portal to a world where art knows no boundaries. It‚Äôs a living, breathing studio of craftspeople that are creating before your very eyes and exploring their own potential. The artists are professionals, restless seekers who have earned a residency in this amazing space and are driven to collaborate and foster community (apparent by the frequent banter found on each story).  The unassuming building opens to a spiral staircase that leads up, up, up into a bevy of visual wonders - and there isn‚Äôt a single corner untouched by something magical. We spent hours canoodling on each floor, which was distinct and projected its own identity.  59 Rivoli isn‚Äôt a typical museum, and as such does not require an entrance fee. That said, they do accept donations, which I highly recommend. The first floor (‚Äú0‚Äù in Paris, n‚Äôest pas?) did feature recognized talent from other locales - in our case, we saw an American by way of Barcelona - as well as some live artists producing and selling in the common area.  What an awesome gem to unearth. It‚Äôs located in a fantastic neighborhood with a plethora of cafes and boulangeries that are perfect for chatting and discussing the work over a glass of wine and warm baguette. Don‚Äôt miss this place.

Exploring the place with artists' exhibitions was a unique and fantastic experience. The diverse array of artistic expressions created an immersive atmosphere, leaving a lasting impression. Each exhibit felt like a journey into the creative minds of the artists, making the visit not only visually stimulating but also intellectually enriching. The fusion of talent and imagination in this artistic haven made it a truly memorable and inspiring outing.

Cool exhibition! You actually get to see artists doing their thing. Every floor has different things, it‚Äôs great. It wasn‚Äôt too crowded when we went and it‚Äôs free. Defos a must go if you love contemporary art

While I was out and about shopping, I stumbled upon 59 Rivoli, and I'm so glad I did. What a gem! I loved seeing the murals and works of art by local Parisiens. Walking through each floor seeing some art being created in real time and the finished pieces was awesome. I've never been in a place where you can watch artists create like this. I hope more places like this pop up (especially in the US) to help promote local artists and get the general public engaged with art created by folks near them. Kudos to the people who make 59 Rivoli such a dope place to visit!

What a wonderful place! So many incredible art pieces and artists. We could talk to some about their work and even watch them create their newest pieces. The space itself is a piece of Art, with amazing murals and poetry flying around.
My second time at 59 Rivoli, one of the best local art experiences you can have in Paris, and it's in the middle of the shopping and restaurant district.  If you are in Paris, make sure you go.

One of my favourite places to visit when I‚Äôm in Paris. I‚Äôve been on all three of my trips and always enjoy the art. It‚Äôs also a great place to snap photos. Plus it‚Äôs free to enter, but you can leave the artists a tip.  The stairs are an experience in themselves and it‚Äôs always cool to see what the resident artists are creating. If you‚Äôre lucky, you might even get to chat to them. It‚Äôs very different from the galleries, providing a more grungy art experience.

It is gallery. It is studio. It is for free. You can see various pieces of art, pictures, statues, various installations. There are 6 floors and each one is unique. The staircase is heart of this builindg. You can also meet artists and discuss with them. I really recommend to visit.

Omg wow - free exhibition but one of the best I‚Äôve seen in the city. Highly recommend the whole place is magical! Take some cash as there are lots of cute little things you can buy from the resident artists.
A great place to spend a few hours on several floors of this gallery.
Such a cool find we stumbled upon and even better it was free.  It use to be a squatter spot now turn into evolving art gallery for fun and talented artists that rotate

This was an amazing experience. Found this place as I was walking by. Plenty of things to look at and so many different styles of art. You can see the artists themselves create the art on the spot and even purchase some of their creation. Such an interesting feeling walking around different studios, you would have to go there to experience it. Would go again for sure

Amazing experience. DIY-exhibit particularly was very delightful, you could write down your favorite book or moment on a giant poster and read through previous entries. The artists all had good work too look at and were there themselves. Not to mention the stairs, loved looking at all the details. A good photo spot as well.

Very interesting concept. All floors are individually mind-blowing. The artists are all so talented & it‚Äôs a must see. Walking into each artist‚Äôs space felt like meeting them personally. Try to support them by donating or posting their artwork & mentioning them!

This is a nice art building where each floor features different artists showcasing their work. Even as someone who isn‚Äôt a huge art fan, it was enjoyable to walk around and explore. The fact that the artists are there creating their art is especially interesting.

Absolutely one of the coolest things I saw on this trip - various artists have their own spaces on each floor in which to express their creativity. Each one is so different, and they are all fantastic - so much talent under one roof! Absolutely a must see!
Officialy legalized art squat, free entrance so don't forget to leave some tips if you won't buy nothing from artists

This space is solely dedicated to artists and their studios. You get the chance to see works in progress and finished pieces which I really like (the process is the best part to learn from). There‚Äôs a relatively wide breadth of content between all the studios‚Äî some abstract, realistic, and some overtly disturbing on the top floor, but overall the content is pleasant to look at. I would just go just for the novelty of the space alone. If you plan on taking kids here there is some nude imagery but it‚Äôs pretty tame.

The interior of the art gallery was stunning. Watching artists during their work was very enriching and inspiring experience. Moreover it was for free and you can choose an artist which you can always support by buying his artworks. I would highly recommend this to any artistic soul who visits Paris! :)

I love the unique art experience all the artists have joined to create. They make me feel the creativity even from the stair decors. It's even free entry and u have the chance to get things custom made for you. Highly recommend

Resident artists can be seen creating new pieces every time, is a good way to look into the creation process. Nice way to start the day before heading to the Pompidou Centre. There is also a gallery on the first floor that brings new collections.

Highly recommend to visitÔºÅ Beautiful and Artistic building,many artists are there to show their art pieces. No entrance fee, if you visit Paris it is a must have item on your travelling list and buy something here to support them.
Free entry. Really nice building in which artists work and show their art. New rotation every six months.
A must see for any art lover , this space is full of wonderful talent . Take a walk up the colourful staircase and each level is rooms full of wonders

This is a very cool spot. The building, and staircase in particular, is definitely worth checking out. I got there just as they opened and while the overall vibe at the entrance and on the stairs is amazing, the studios were a little more difficult to decipher in terms of the art being created.
Very artistic place in the center of Paris

Accidentally found this place and I would recommend it as an intentional go to art inspirational Parisian experience. Of course if your in the market for modern art by new passionate this is your place.
Great place with lost of different artworks , lot's of new experience Gain while visiting

A very creative modern art hub in Chatelet. There was a temporary exhibition by 3 Argentinian female artists in the ground floor. Each of the remaining 6 floors feels like a separate world than the others. Various artists display their work, and you might catch them in action working on their newest masterpiece. Even the stairs itself is a masterpiece on its own, with drawings, writing on each step, and stickers. Highly recommend visiting it

Wonderful street artists‚Äô studios to visit and support. Even the staircase is full of beauty. Be sure to walk every floor and support flourishing artists, both young and mature. The world needs more art and to support its artists. ü´∂üèºüíï ‚Ä¶
